metadata.title: CVE-2024-42150 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net: txgbe: remove separate irq request for MSI and INTxWhen using MSI or INTx interrupts, request_irq() for pdev->irq willconflict with request_threaded_irq() for txgbe->misc.irq, to causesystem crash. So remove txgbe_request_irq() for MSI/INTx case, andrename txgbe_request_msix_irqs() since it only request for queue irqs.Add wx->misc_irq_domain to determine whether the driver creates an IRQdomain and threaded request the IRQs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42150` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31

No subscription required
